title: Restate configuration file
description:
Configuration for the Restate single binary deployment.

You can specify the configuration file to use through the `--config-file <PATH>` argument or with `RESTATE_CONFIG=<PATH>` environment variable.

Each configuration entry can be overridden using environment variables, prefixing them with `RESTATE_` and separating nested structs with `__` (double underscore). For example, to configure `meta.rest_address`, the corresponding environment variable is `RESTATE_META__REST_ADDRESS`.

shutdown_grace_period.title: Shutdown grace timeout
shutdown_grace_period.description:
This timeout is used when shutting down the various Restate components to drain all the internal queues.

Can be configured using the [`humantime`](https://docs.rs/humantime/latest/humantime/fn.parse_duration.html) format.

TracingOptions.title: Tracing Options
TracingOptions.description:
Configuration for the [OTLP exporter](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/otel/protocol/exporter/) which can export to all OTLP compatible systems (e.g. Jaeger).

To configure the sampling, please refer to the [opentelemetry autoconfigure docs](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-java/blob/main/sdk-extensions/autoconfigure/README.md#sampler).

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.description: Specify the tracing endpoint to send traces to. Traces will be exported using [OTLP gRPC](https://opentelemetry.io/docs/specs/otlp/#otlpgrpc) through [opentelemetry_otlp](https://docs.rs/opentelemetry-otlp/0.12.0/opentelemetry_otlp/).

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Exporter filter configuration. Check the [`RUST_LOG` documentation](https://docs.rs/tracing-subscriber/latest/tracing_subscriber/filter/struct.EnvFilter.html) for more details how to configure it.

JaegerFileOptions.title: Jaeger File Options
JaegerFileOptions.description:
Configuration for the Jaeger file exporter. This exporter writes traces as JSON in the Jaeger format.

It can be used to export traces in a structured format without configuring a Jaeger agent. To inspect the traces, open the Jaeger UI and use the Upload JSON feature to load and inspect them.

All spans will be sampled.

path.title: Path
path.description: Specify the path where all the traces will be exported. Each trace file will start with the `trace` prefix.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Exporter filter configuration. Check the [`RUST_LOG` documentation](https://docs.rs/tracing-subscriber/latest/tracing_subscriber/filter/struct.EnvFilter.html) for more details how to configure it.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Log filter configuration. Can be overridden by the `RUST_LOG` environment variable. Check the [`RUST_LOG` documentation](https://docs.rs/tracing-subscriber/latest/tracing_subscriber/filter/struct.EnvFilter.html) for more details how to configure it.

disable_ansi_codes.title: Disable ANSI log
disable_ansi_codes.description: Disable ANSI terminal codes for logs. This is useful when the log collector doesn't support processing ANSI terminal codes.

oneOf.title: Pretty
oneOf.description: Enables verbose logging. Not recommended in production.

oneOf.title: Json
oneOf.description: Enables json logging. You can use a json log collector to ingest these logs and further process them.

rest_address.title: Rest endpoint address
rest_address.description: Address to bind for the Meta Operational REST APIs.

rest_concurrency_limit.title: Rest concurrency limit
rest_concurrency_limit.description: Concurrency limit for the Meta Operational REST APIs.

proxy_uri.title: Proxy URI
proxy_uri.description: A URI, such as `http://127.0.0.1:10001`, of a server to which all invocations should be sent, with the `Host` header set to the service endpoint URI. HTTPS proxy URIs are supported, but only HTTP endpoint traffic will be proxied currently. Can be overridden by the `HTTP_PROXY` environment variable.

partitions.title: Partitions
partitions.description:
Number of partitions to be used to process messages.

Note: This config entry **will be removed** in future Restate releases, as the partitions number will be dynamically configured depending on the load.

num_timers_in_memory_limit.title: Num timers in memory limit
num_timers_in_memory_limit.description: The number of timers in memory limit is used to bound the amount of timers loaded in memory. If this limit is set, when exceeding it, the timers farther in the future will be spilled to disk.

bind_address.title: Bind address
bind_address.description: The address to bind for the storage grpc service.

path.title: Storage path
path.description: The root path to use for the Rocksdb storage.

threads.title: Threads
threads.description: The number of threads to reserve to Rocksdb background tasks.

write_buffer_size.title: Write Buffer size
write_buffer_size.description: The size of a single memtable. Once memtable exceeds this size, it is marked immutable and a new one is created.

max_total_wal_size.title: Maximum total WAL size
max_total_wal_size.description: Max WAL size, that after this Rocksdb start flushing mem tables to disk.

cache_size.title: Maximum cache size
cache_size.description: The memory size used for rocksdb caches.

bind_address.title: Bind address
bind_address.description: The address to bind for the ingress.

concurrency_limit.title: Concurrency limit
concurrency_limit.description: Local concurrency limit to use to limit the amount of concurrent requests. If exceeded, the ingress will reply immediately with an appropriate status code.

deserialize_deny_unknown_fields.title: Deserialize: deny unknown fields
deserialize_deny_unknown_fields.description: When deserializing, return an error when encountering unknown message fields.

serialize_stringify_64_bit_integers.title: Serialize: stringify 64 bit integers
serialize_stringify_64_bit_integers.description:
When serializing, encode 64-bit integral types as strings.

For more details, check the [prost-reflect](https://docs.rs/prost-reflect/0.11.4/prost_reflect/struct.SerializeOptions.html#method.stringify_64_bit_integers) and [Protobuf encoding](https://protobuf.dev/programming-guides/proto3/#json-options) documentation

serialize_use_enum_numbers.title: Serialize: use enum numbers
serialize_use_enum_numbers.description:
When serializing, encode enum values as their numeric value.

For more details, check the [prost-reflect](https://docs.rs/prost-reflect/0.11.4/prost_reflect/struct.SerializeOptions.html#method.use_enum_numbers) and [Protobuf encoding](https://protobuf.dev/programming-guides/proto3/#json-options) documentation

serialize_use_proto_field_name.title: Serialize: use proto field name
serialize_use_proto_field_name.description:
When serializing, use the proto field name instead of the lowerCamelCase name in JSON field names.

For more details, check the [prost-reflect](https://docs.rs/prost-reflect/0.11.4/prost_reflect/struct.SerializeOptions.html#method.use_proto_field_name) and [Protobuf encoding](https://protobuf.dev/programming-guides/proto3/#json-options) documentation

serialize_skip_default_fields.title: Serialize: skip default fields
serialize_skip_default_fields.description:
When serializing, skip fields which have their default value.

For more details, check the [prost-reflect](https://docs.rs/prost-reflect/0.11.4/prost_reflect/struct.SerializeOptions.html#method.skip_default_fields) and [Protobuf encoding](https://protobuf.dev/programming-guides/proto3/#json-options) documentation

retry_policy.title: Retry policy
retry_policy.description: Retry policy to use for all the invocations handled by this invoker.

suspension_timeout.title: Suspension timeout
suspension_timeout.description:
This timer is used to gracefully shutdown a bidirectional stream after inactivity on both request and response streams.

When this timer is fired, the invocation will be closed gracefully by closing the request stream, triggering a suspension on the sdk, in case the sdk is waiting on a completion. This won't affect the response stream.

Can be configured using the [`humantime`](https://docs.rs/humantime/latest/humantime/fn.parse_duration.html) format.

response_abort_timeout.title: Response abort timeout
response_abort_timeout.description:
This timer is used to forcefully shutdown an invocation when only the response stream is open.

When protocol mode is `restate_service_metadata::ProtocolType::RequestResponse`, this timer will start as soon as the replay of the journal is completed. When protocol mode is `restate_service_metadata::ProtocolType::BidiStream`, this timer will start after the request stream has been closed. Check `suspension_timeout` to configure a timer on the request stream.

When this timer is fired, the response stream will be aborted, potentially **interrupting** user code! If the user code needs longer to complete, then this value needs to be set accordingly.

Can be configured using the [`humantime`](https://docs.rs/humantime/latest/humantime/fn.parse_duration.html) format.

message_size_warning.title: Message size warning
message_size_warning.description: Threshold to log a warning in case protocol messages coming from service endpoint are larger than the specified amount.

message_size_limit.title: Message size limit
message_size_limit.description: Threshold to fail the invocation in case protocol messages coming from service endpoint are larger than the specified amount.

proxy_uri.title: Proxy URI
proxy_uri.description: A URI, such as `http://127.0.0.1:10001`, of a server to which all invocations should be sent, with the `Host` header set to the service endpoint URI. HTTPS proxy URIs are supported, but only HTTP endpoint traffic will be proxied currently. Can be overridden by the `HTTP_PROXY` environment variable.

tmp_dir.title: Temporary directory
tmp_dir.description: Temporary directory to use for the invoker temporary files. If empty, the system temporary directory will be used instead.

concurrency_limit.title: Concurrency limit
concurrency_limit.description: Number of concurrent invocations that can be processed by the invoker.

oneOf.title: Fixed delay
oneOf.description: Retry with a fixed delay strategy.

interval.title: Interval
interval.description:
Interval between retries.

Can be configured using the [`humantime`](https://docs.rs/humantime/latest/humantime/fn.parse_duration.html) format.

max_attempts.title: Max attempts
max_attempts.description: Number of maximum attempts before giving up.

oneOf.title: Exponential
oneOf.description: Retry with an exponential strategy. The next retry is computed as `min(last_retry_interval * factor, max_interval)`.

initial_interval.title: Initial Interval
initial_interval.description:
Initial interval for the first retry attempt.

Can be configured using the [`humantime`](https://docs.rs/humantime/latest/humantime/fn.parse_duration.html) format.

factor.title: Factor
factor.description: The factor to use to compute the next retry attempt.

max_attempts.title: Max attempts
max_attempts.description: Number of maximum attempts before giving up.

Options.title: Runtime options
Options.description: Configuration for the Tokio runtime used by Restate.

worker_threads.title: Worker threads
worker_threads.description: Configure the number of [worker threads](https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/runtime/struct.Builder.html#method.worker_threads) of the Tokio runtime. If not set, it uses the Tokio default, where worker_threads is equal to number of cores.

max_blocking_threads.title: Max blocking threads
max_blocking_threads.description: Configure the number of [max blocking threads](https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/runtime/struct.Builder.html#method.max_blocking_threads) of the Tokio runtime. If not set, it uses the Tokio default 512.
